column2: With the Tohoku region once more at peace it is time to decide what to do with the land I have acquired as part of the peace deal. If I'm not keeping it, I should also withdraw from the region.
The land belongs to Fujiwara Kiyohira!
The land belongs to Fujiwara Kiyohira!
The land belongs to the Kiyohara clan!
The land belongs to me!
The land belongs to the Regent!
The land belongs to the Chrysanthemum Throne!

Despite my assistance during the war and my rightful claim it seems like [From.GetBestName] has seen fit to declare that Mutsu is the rightful property of Fujiwara Kiyohira. Maybe I should dispute this by force of arms?
No, there shall be peace...
Summon my warriors! We march to Mutsu!

Though it was unclear at first if [From.GetBestName] would see fit to accept my decision to give Mutsu to Fujiwara Kiyohira [From.GetSheHe] seems to have accepted my decision and has agreed to enter into an agreement regarding a formal truce.
My work here is done!

It seems [From.GetBestName] is unwilling to accept the fact that Mutsu rightfully belongs to Fujiwara Kiyohira and my decision to give it to him, seeing as [From.GetSheHe] has seen fit to declare war to press [From.GetHerHis] claim on the region.
To arms!

Though I initially feared that [From.GetBestName] would have seen fit to keep Mutsu or to hand it off to someone else I have learned that [From.GetSheHe] is prepared to hand it over to me, recognizing my legal claim.
I am glad [From.GetSheHe] saw reason!

I have just received word from the Tohoku region that [FromFrom.GetBestName] has seen fit to turn over Mutsu to [From.GetBestName] following the end of the Northern Disturbance, which apparently is agreeable to all involved parties.
That's good news, I suppose...
I don't care about the north!

Word has reached me that [From.GetBestName] was not particularly interested to learn that I had been given control of the Tohoku region as a whole. If [From.GetSheHe] is not interested in what happens here, do I really want to remain an imperial subject?
I am loyal to the Chrysanthemum Throne!
I will create my own realm!

Despite my assistance in the war and my rightful claim it seems like [From.GetBestName] has seen fit to declare that [From.GetSheHe] should remain in control of Mutsu to ensure a lasting peace. Maybe I should dispute this by force of arms?
No, there shall be peace...
Summon my warriors! We march to Mutsu!

I intially feared that [From.GetBestName] would oppose my decision to retain control over Mutsu, but it seems [From.GetSheHe] has seen reason as [From.GetSheHe] has let it be known that [From.GetSheHe] is willing to sign a treaty stipulating a lasting truce.
That's great!

It seems [From.GetBestName] views [From.GetHerHis] personal glory as more important than what is best for the Chrysanthemum Throne, seeing as [From.GetSheHe] has refused to accept my decision to retain control over Mutsu and has declared war.
To arms!

[From.GetBestName] has finally secured peace in the Tohoku region, and instead of giving Mutsu to one of the claimants or keeping it for [From.GetHerselfHimself] [From.GetSheHe] has seen fit to turn over the land to me so that I may distribute it as I see fit.
If only all subjects were this loyal!

To my great surprise, it seems [FromFrom.GetBestName] has seen fit to turn over Mutsu to [From.GetBestName] following the end of the Northern Disturbance. It would be seen as treasonous to object to this peace settlement, but I should not forget this slight.
[FromFrom.GetSheHeCap] should have given it to me!

Though it seemed quite unlikely at first I have managed to come out ahead in the Northern Disturbance, and now I control the Tohoku region. Since the region is at peace I doubt the Chrysanthemum Throne will object.
I think this is quite satisfactory!

I have just received word from the Tohoku region that the Northern Disturbance has come to an end, with [From.GetBestName] being the victor. [From.GetSheHeCap] is now in firm control of the Tohoku region.
That's good news, I suppose...
The north is irrelevant!

Word has reached me that [From.GetBestName] was not particularly interested to learn that I control the Tohoku region as a whole due to my recent victory. If [From.GetSheHe] is not interested in what happens here, do I really need to remain an imperial subject?
I am loyal to the Chrysanthemum Throne!
I will create my own realm!
With the Tohoku region finally at peace I need to decide whether I wish to remain in the region or if I should hand it over to someone else and focus on other matters elsewhere.
I will give the north to Fujiwara Kiyohira!
I will keep the north!
I will give the north to the Regent!
I will give the north to the Chrysanthemum Throne!

I have just received word that [From.GetBestName] has seen fit to recognize my rightful claim to the Tohoku region following the end of the Northern Disturbance and that [From.GetSheHe] will depart the region, leaving it in my capable hands.
This will surely please everyone!

I have just received word from the Tohoku region that the Northern Disturbance has come to an end, with [From.GetBestName] being granted control of the region following [FromFrom.GetBestName]'s victory.
That's good news, I suppose...
The north is irrelevant!

Word has reached me that [From.GetBestName] was not particularly interested to learn that I control the Tohoku region as a whole. If [From.GetSheHe] is not interested in what happens here, do I really need to remain an imperial subject?
I am loyal to the Chrysanthemum Throne!
I will create my own realm!
Despite previous assurances to do exactly that [From.GetBestName] has not seen fit to give me control of the Tohoku region following [From.GetHerHis] recent victory in the Northern Disturbance.
I won't forget this!
[From.GetBestName] has finally secured peace in the Tohoku region, and [From.GetSheHe] has seen fit to turn over the land [From.GetSheHe] obtained to me so that I may distribute it as I see fit.
If only all subjects were this loyal!

To my great surprise, it seems [FromFrom.GetBestName] has seen fit to turn over Mutsu to [From.GetBestName] following the end of the Northern Disturbance. It would be seen as treasonous to object to this peace settlement, but I should not forget this slight.
[FromFrom.GetSheHeCap] should have given it to me!
I have managed to come out ahead in the Northern Disturbance, and now I control the Tohoku region. Since the region is at peace I doubt the Chrysanthemum Throne will object to this outcome.
I think this is quite satisfactory!

I have just received word from the Tohoku region that the Northern Disturbance has come to an end, with [From.GetBestName] being the victor. [From.GetSheHeCap] is now in firm control of the Tohoku region.
That's good news, I suppose...
The north is irrelevant!

Word has reached me that [From.GetBestName] was not particularly interested to learn that I now control the Tohoku region as a whole due to my recent victory. If [From.GetSheHe] is not interested in what happens here, do I really want to remain an imperial subject?
I am loyal to the Chrysanthemum Throne!
I will create my own realm!
With my realm finally at peace again the warrior bands that came to my aid are no longer needed, and it is time for them to disperse.
I can bring them back if I need them again!
